Articles.Content:
The rumours were true. The Mun landings were faked! We launched the entire set, cameras and production crew to the Mun to do it. The results fooled the entire world. Now it\'s your turn to relive the event. Self contained and extremely strong, the 'My First Mun Landing Diorama' (also know as project Popcorn One), has everything you could ever need. Includes a life size flag of the KSP institute.

Unfortunately, the original photos were destroyed in a cover up. Please stand by as we launch another rocket to recover the cameras from the Mun.

[sorry the forum no longer lets me post links... so use the upload below or type by hand]

___http://benart.www.idnet.com/TBpopcornOne.zip___

The rumours were true. The Mun landings were faked! We launched the entire set, cameras and production crew to the Mun to do it. The results fooled the entire world. Now it\'s your turn to relive the event. Self contained and extremely strong, the 'My First Mun Landing Diorama' (also know as project Popcorn One), has everything you could ever need. Includes a life size flag of the KSP institute.

Unfortunately, the original photos were destroyed in a cover up. Please stand by as we launch another rocket to recover the cameras from the Mun.

www.idnet.com/TBpopcornOne.zip]Technical Ben Popcorn One

Fixed that for ya.

This is (without the lines)

___http://benart.www.idnet.com/TBpopcornOne.zip___
Why are you putting lines there in the first place?

Image?

This is just lulzy, I read the part.cfg file.

'So we decided to stage it on the MÃ¼n.'

Yeah its broken!

http ://benart. www .idnet.com/TBpopcornOne.zip

Copy and paste, remove the spaces, download file, Win!

like this: www.idnet.com/TBpopcornOne.zip]Technical Ben Popcorn One

Nope, still broken.

can\'t see the image

too fuzzy

far too fuzzy

You\'re going to have to upload to a file host like MediaFire. Your host has a stupid way of configuring their URLs to make users pages sub-domains of the www sub-domain.

Get a better host.

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

*pats Capn on the head*

I thought the same thing.

We already have a bug report in the forum forum, if you can run it up the pole:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=6663.0

Wow, never seen so many people have trouble with links before...

www.idnet.com/TBpopcornOne.zip]TB Popcorn One

[url=http://benart.[url=http://www.idnet.com/TBpopcornOne.zip]www.idnet.com/TBpopcornOne.zip[/url]]TB Popcorn One[/url]

looks like it did the same thing for you lol

Wow, never seen so many people have trouble with links before...

www.idnet.com/TBpopcornOne.zip]www.idnet.com/TBpopcornOne.zip]TB Popcorn One

[url=http://benart.[url=http://www.idnet.com/TBpopcornOne.zip]www.idnet.com/TBpopcornOne.zip[/url]]TB Popcorn One[/url]

AH! I see the problem. It sees the www. part and tries to auto insert tags.

Lol, Duh. ???

The forum AUTO PARSER (YOUTUBE LINKS ETC) is EATING my POSTS.

Ok. So, like if anyone else tries to tell me how I should post my own links and sub domain again, I\'m gonna go crazy.

PS, thanks Capt\'n, I\'m rolling on the floor now after that fail.

I\'ll get this figured out.

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

EDIT: See post above. Your host is an idiot.

No not really. It worked for, oh, like years. Why? Because until now the forum did not auto parse links. Anything a computer does automatically has to either be correct, or able to be manually override. Why? Because computers get it wrong. Sorry I got so annoyed, but there is nothing more annoying than having someone else sit on your hands and yell at you for not lifting your arms...

Can an exception be added to the parser, or can I disable it on my post?

No way to disable that I see, it even parses inside code tags which it definitely should not do.

Normally there would be a disable auto-parsing of links checkbox in the other options area, but it\'s not.

Seriously though, putting a sub-domain on the www sub-domain is lame.

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky
You know that\'s not helping telling me that.

www.

www.dropbox.com

Use these! ;P
This the first time ive seen capt n scunky post so many replies in just 1 thread

I\'ll need more information and/or pictures before I download that.

I want to see what I\'m buying before I pay for it.
Can you at least provide a clearer picture? I don\'t want to download something that I don\'t know what it looks like.
I\'ve downloaded it, but I am hesitant to install it before I can actually SEE it.

This is the best I can refine the image to.

It looks like a red, cloth covered box...

I\'ve downloaded it, but I am hesitant to install it before I can actually SEE it.

It\'s a box that once you open it, looks like a lander and buggy on a grey slab.

Looks like the photo was made from a real satellite. ;P

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

Looks like the photo was made from a real satellite.

That may have been his intention. I\'m all for trying out cool new mods, you need to spend a little more time in 'selling' your mod to us Ben.
